import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets import groovy.json.JsonOutput import attributes.sql
def flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile)return
cat = flowFile.getAttribute('mainCat')
flowFile=session.read(flowFile, {inputStream-> def text = IOUtils.toString(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) sql.path(text.toString(),cat.toString())
} as InputStreamCallback)
session.transfer(flowFile, ExecuteScript.REL_SUCCESS)

entry.value: select last_update from import_details order by last_update desc limit 1;

processGroups.comments:
This flow will track how many times a given flow file routes through it. If the number of times exceeds a specific maximum then it will route to the 'limit exceeded' port. Otherwise it will route to 'retry'.
The attributes it uses are 'retry.counter' and 'retry.maxcount'. If the 'retry.maxcount' is specified on a given flowfile then it will be honored. Otherwise a default of '3' is set as the maximum retry count.
As the flowfile goes through this flow it increments the 'retry.counter' attribute by 1. It then checks if this value exceeds 'retry.maxcount' and if so then it routes the flowfile to 'limit exceeded' otherwise it routes to 'retry'.
So you can configure the 'retry' relationship to loop back to the process you want and you can send the 'limit exceeded' to move on from that process to something else.

outputPorts.name: limit exceeded
outputPorts.validationErrors: 'Port 'limit exceeded'' is invalid because Output connection for port 'limit exceeded' is not defined.

outputPorts.comments: Items sent to this port have not yet exceeded the maximum retry count.
outputPorts.name: retry

processGroups.name: Retry Check Loop for Keywords

config.comments: This process contains a groovy script for passing the transformed json content to java code (contained by same processor in the form of jar) which will store all these content in SQL using the stored procedure for product and attributes.

entry.value:
import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets import groovy.json.JsonOutput import attributes.transform
flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile)return
session.write(flowFile, {inputStream,outputStream-> def text = IOUtils.toString(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) def o = transform.doAttrStore(text.toString())
outputStream.write(o.getBytes()) } as StreamCallback)
session.transfer(flowFile, ExecuteScript.REL_SUCCESS)

entry.value: INSERT INTO product_attributes (att_group_id,att_group_val_id,product_id,stock,price_change,STATUS,product_url,original_product_id) VALUES (${att_group_id},${att_group_val_id},(SELECT id FROM products WHERE vendor_product_id = '${active_id}' AND vendor_id ='${vendor_id}'),'${stock}',${price},'1','${product_url}',?);

INSERT INTO attributes_value(id,att_group_id,att_value,STATUS) VALUES (${att_group_val_id},${att_group_id},'${att_group_value}','1') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE att_group_id = ${att_group_id}, att_value = '${att_group_value}', STATUS = '1';
